title: How do I get Firefox to go directly to the URL I type in the address bar instead of going to Google and doing a search for the addresses?
content:
Hi, I have a Mac running Firefox 84.0.2 and when I type a URL in the address bar and hit return it goes directly to that site.

On my new Mac running the same version of Firefox when I type in a URL it takes me to Google.

Notice in the first screen shot I typed in 'Mozilla' and it took me directly to this page. In the second screen on my new Mac the screen shot shows what happened when I typed 'Mozilla' in the address bar. It took me to Google.

I appreciate any suggestions you might have. I have spent some time trying to figure it out.

Scott
creator: scottito

title: privacy.resist.fingerprinting resets to true when firefox restarts
content: I use canvas blocker so I need privacy.resist.fingerprinting to be set to false. I have repeatedly set it to false in about:config and by editing prefs.json and every time I restart firefox it resets to true. I have done a clean install of firefox, turned off and deleted every add on, and tried using a new profile but it has not cleared the issue.

title: Cannot Open Websites with Keepass2 after Upgrade to Firefox 85
content: I have been using Firefox and Keepass2 for years. Until the upgrade to Firefox 85, I could use Keepass2 to open websites requiring login names and passwords. Now (most of the time) Keepass2 is not opening the websites I need to go to. I think something happened when you put in the option to use Firefox 85 to import or use the Keepass2 data base to maintain maintain login names and passwords in Firefox 85. Please check on this and let me know what the problem is and if I need to do something in either Keepass2 or Firefox 85 to fix this. I want to continue using Keepass2 to enter login names and passwords and not have them remembered by Firefox 85.
creator: judynjima

title: How to restore bookmark backup when sync is active?
content:
Hi I am encountering a strange issue. I have two firefox computers and syncing is active.

I am trying to restore a previous version of my bookmarks (using the bookmarks library, Import and backup menu, restore function). My problem is that at one of the following sync (ie within usually a couple of hours max) the previous set of bookmarks is systematically restored by sync.

I have un-registered / re-registered both computers, tried to use a different backups (from recent history or from a file export), tried to run sync immediately after the restore... nothing helps.

I activated log on success for sync. Apparently the restore is just ignored as I get this: Sync.Engine.Bookmarks.BookmarkSyncUtils DEBUG pushChanges: Processed change records: {"weak":0,"skipped":0,"updated":0} and later, suddenly the browser realises that lots of bookmarks are missing and cancels all the changes: " Sync.Engine.Bookmarks.BookmarkSyncUtils DEBUG pushChanges: Processed change records: {"weak":0,"skipped":0,"updated":4764} "

Has anyone faced the same issue? Is there a way to force a unidirectional push from the browser to the server? Thanks

PS: FF 85, one on Win10 and the other on MacOS Big Sur. Same behaviour on both machines. PPS: The machines are in two different locations. It is impossible for me to force the change simultaneously on both computers.
creator: alex.v

title: Old history
content:
Hi,

This evening I rebooted my laptop and when I came to use Firefox again it decided to install the new version, wiping all my data in the process.

Luckily, I had backed up my bookmarks earlier in the day but unfortunately not my history.

Is there any way to get it back?

title: Printing Emails from Comcast Infinity
content: I run an IMac with High Sierra. Today I updated FireFox to the latest version (85.0 64-bit). Then I noticed that when I print Emails the sender and subject are blocked out by what looks like a bar code. I disabled all add-ons but nothing made a difference. When using the other browser, Safari, which I don't want to use since Apple stopped supporting this OS it doesn't happen and every Email prints out just fine. Also, if I print with a screen shot the bar code doesn't appear. I am a very low level user and any help would be appreciated. MC
creator: MChBoater

title: Firefox displays some emails / websites with strange characters
content:
For a few weeks now, i have noticed that some emails (newsletters) and some websites show up with these odd characters instead of regular text. When you copy paste the characters into an email, they show the correct text in English, but as it arrives in my mailbox, it looks encrypted or something like that.

Does anyone know what to do? I already updated it, checked my font settings (it's set to allow websites to choose their own), I checked it with the option of not allowing websites to choose their own also and it got worse, so the settings are pretty standard.

It does not affect all emails, but very selectively a few, and does not happen on other browsers either. Just on firefox.

Has anyone experienced this??
creator: ILHIHP

title: Can't fix SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL as described
content:
Hi all,

while playing (or better "fighting"...) with a linux docker container on Win10/WSL2/Ubuntu for using the MS spfx tool chain, I generated a SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL in FF85.0/Win10 by first setting up a certificate exception for a dev-cert (https://localhost:4321) and then have the certificate re-created.

As described the support article [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/Certificate-contains-the-same-serial...], I removed all certificate exceptions for localhost:* and deleted the "gulp" authority in options/security/certificates.

Unfortunately, the SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL persists even after a restart of firefox.

Any help is very much appreciated...

Thanks & greetings Markus Fehn
creator: markus.fehn

title: Do firefox use the same account on Windows and Mac?
content:
I am new to firefox. I created a firefox account in firefox browser in Windows first, and imported bookmarks, etc., from my chrome browser. Next I installed firefox in my Ubuntu OS, and it worked fine, the account can be logged-on and everything was synced.

I get the problem when I install firefox on my Mac. I installed the same firefox browser version as I installed on my Windows, except that it was for the Mac. I tried to log-on with the account before, but it asked me to create a new account, even if I use the same email address to register my firefox account before on Windows. So, do firefox use the same account on Windows and Mac? Is there a fix to this problem?
creator: yangyi0318
